snippet: An expert weighs in on the effort to crowd-source the weaponry being used against the Syrian city of Homs.
abstract: An expert weighs in on the effort to crowd-source the weaponry being used against the Syrian city of Homs.
lead_paragraph: On Thursday, a blogger who writes on Twitter as @ArabSpringFF posted an image of what was said to be an unexploded shell used in the Syrian military assault on parts of the city of Homs that have slipped from government control. C.J. Chivers, a Times correspondent and the author of "The Gun," a social history of the AK-47, tried to answer that question in a post on his personal Tumblr blog, which has been adapted for use here with his permission.

headline.main: Tracing the Weapons of Bashar al-Assad
